p: Seventeen articles describing 231 COVID-19 patients with rheumatic diseases were found during the literature search (Fig. 1) [ 27– 43]. Among these patients, there was only one pediatric patient who was a 6-month-old infant with Kawasaki disease and COVID-19 [ 31]. The characteristics of the patients are presented in Table 1. 77.5% of the patients were female ( n = 179). The most common underlying rheumatic diseases were systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) ( n = 117) and rheumatoid arthritis (RA) ( n = 45). Nine out of 231 (3.9%) patients died. Of note, Konig et al. did not report outcomes with regard to mortality in their COVID-19 cohort, including 80 SLE patients [ 41].
